summary: This is an email chain from May 2019 between a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutor and FBI personnel, discussing efforts to contact a potential victim/witness in the Epstein investigation. The prosecutor provides background on the individual, noting she was met by Epstein in high school, is believed to be a victim, and was potentially a recruiter. The email coordinates initial contact and a planned in-person interview in California.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email providing background on a potential witness/victim and coordinating contact efforts with the FBI.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is investigating Epstein and providing background on his connection to a potential victim.

events.title: Coordination to Contact Potential Victim/Witness
events.description: The SDNY prosecutor and FBI personnel coordinate to make initial contact with a potential victim/witness in California, with plans to meet her in person later in the month.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document is a 2019 email from the SDNY prosecutor's office to the FBI coordinating contact with a potential victim/witness.
The individual in question was met by Jeffrey Epstein while she was in high school and is believed to have been one of his victims.
Her name appears in only one FBI 302 report, which states Epstein bought her a car and that she was also a recruiter.
The prosecutor notes she has never been interviewed by law enforcement before.
The email discusses providing the individual with counsel if needed and planning an in-person meeting in California.
